strings.Value: "I overreacted. Forgive me."
"Let's forget about it."
"Never — I repeat — never again stand in my way, Tristian."
"Will you come with me to the meeting?"
"Amalia looked at you very fondly, don't you think?"
"We have to go, Tristian."
"Oh, stop. A little fun wouldn't be so bad, would it?"
"Right. Let's get down to business."
"What do you think awaits us at the meeting?"
"Is something wrong?"

{n}Tristian looks down at the leaflet he's still holding. His face is sad.{/n} "A meeting at the appointed place... there are even directions how to get there. It looks like it's time we visit this sacrament."
{n}You see anger on Tristian's face for the first time since you've known him.{/n} "What's got into you? This was an innocent child, only repeating someone else's words!"
{n}Tristian holds your stare.{/n} "I will pray to {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g} that I will never have to do it again."
{n}Tristian breathes out.{/n} "Just... just try not to let this happen again."

{n}Tristian smiles half-heartedly.{/n} "I'm not the one you should apologize to, {name}. Instead, apologize to the poor frightened girl. Anyway, nothing terrible happened, so let's get back to business."
{n}Tristian shakes his head and turns grim.{/n} "You distract us from our goal."
{n}Tristian cringes.{/n} "Please stop. Not only is she merely a child, but she's also under the influence of these insane preachings. I must help her, not take advantage of her gullibility."
{n}Tristian looks again at the leaflet he's holding.{/n}
"I would insist on participating in this investigation. I cannot let you go alone, after I dragged you into this strange affair."

{n}Tristian looks pensively into the distance.{/n} "Whatever awaits, this mysterious First Faithful will be there. Judging by his title, he's the one who invented this insane Kingdom. I believe that talking to him will solve many of the riddles we face."

{n}Tristian sighs heavily.{/n} "I worship {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g} myself. But my faith has little in common with the faith of these cultists. They fill the heads of innocent children with pernicious and dangerous ideas, which they cannot fully understand."
{n}Tristian looks at you sideways, a shy smile creeping across his face.{/n} "Funny you should notice. An unusual observation. But please, let's return to the matter at hand."
